t: Isaiah 43
Israel’s Only Savior
But*pn now thus says the Lord,*s he*ln who created you, O Jacob, he*ld who formed you, O Israel: “Fear*ln not, for I have redeemed you; I*ld have called you by name, you are mine.

When*ln you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and*ld through the rivers, they shall not overwhelm you; when*ln you walk through fire you shall not be burned, and*ld the flame shall not consume you.
For*ln I am the Lord*s your God, the*ld Holy One of Israel, your Savior. I*ln give Egypt as your ransom, Cush*ld and Seba in exchange for you.
Because*ln you are precious in my eyes, and*ld honored, and I love you, I*ln give men in return for you, peoples*ld in exchange for your life.
Fear*ln not, for I am with you; I*ld will bring your offspring from the east, and*ld from the west I will gather you.
I*ln will say to the north, Give up, and*ld to the south, Do not withhold; bring*ln my sons from afar and*ld my daughters from the end of the earth,
everyone*ln who is called by my name, whom*ld I created for my glory, whom*ld I formed and made.”
Bring*pn out the people who are blind, yet have eyes, who*ld are deaf, yet have ears!

All*ln the nations gather together, and*ld the peoples assemble. Who*ln among them can declare this, and*ld show us the former things? Let*ln them bring their witnesses to prove them right, and*ld let them hear and say, It is true.

“You*ln are my witnesses,” declares the Lord,*s “and*ld my servant whom I have chosen, that*ln you may know and believe me and*ld understand that I am he. Before*ln me no god was formed, nor*ld shall there be any after me.
I,*ln I am the Lord,*s and*ld besides me there is no savior.
I*ln declared and saved and proclaimed, when*ld there was no strange god among you; and*ld you are my witnesses,” declares the Lord,*s “and I am God.
Also*ln henceforth I am he; there*ld is none who can deliver from my hand; I*ld work, and who can turn it back?”

Thus*pn says the Lord,*s your*ld Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: “For*ln your sake I send to Babylon and*ld bring them all down as fugitives, even*ld the Chaldeans, in the ships in which they rejoice.
I*ln am the Lord,*s your Holy One, the*ld Creator of Israel, your King.”
Thus*pn says the Lord,*s who*ld makes a way in the sea, a*ld path in the mighty waters,
who*ln brings forth chariot and horse, army*ld and warrior; they*ln lie down, they cannot rise, they*ld are extinguished, quenched like a wick:
“Remember*ln not the former things, nor*ld consider the things of old.
Behold,*ln I am doing a new thing; now*ld it springs forth, do you not perceive it? I*ln will make a way in the wilderness and*ld rivers in the desert.
The*ln wild beasts will honor me, the*ld jackals and the ostriches, for*ln I give water in the wilderness, rivers*ld in the desert, to*ln give drink to my chosen people,
the*ld people whom I formed for myself that*ln they might declare my praise.
“Yet*pn you did not call upon me, O Jacob; but*ld you have been weary of me, O Israel!
You*ln have not brought me your sheep for burnt offerings, or*ld honored me with your sacrifices. I*ln have not burdened you with offerings, or*ld wearied you with frankincense.
You*ln have not bought me sweet cane with money, or*ld satisfied me with the fat of your sacrifices. But*ln you have burdened me with your sins; you*ld have wearied me with your iniquities.
“I,*pn I am he who*ld blots out your transgressions for my own sake, and*ld I will not remember your sins.
Put*ln me in remembrance; let us argue together; set*ld forth your case, that you may be proved right.
Your*ln first father sinned, and*ld your mediators transgressed against me.
Therefore*ln I will profane the princes of the sanctuary, and*ld deliver Jacob to utter destruction and*ld Israel to reviling.
